doc.description:
A permission system linked to options, user classes and preferences.
From the moment a user or a group has a preference on an item, it is considered to have a permission. Deleting a permission deletes the preference

tags.todo: Store the deleted preferences? And restore them if the a permission is re-given

name: bbn\user\permissions

__construct.name: __construct

from_path.name: from_path
from_path.summary: Returns the option's ID corresponds to the given path.

to_path.name: to_path

options.name: options
options.summary: Returns the result of appui\options::options filtered with only the ones authorized to the current user.

full_options.name: full_options
full_options.summary: Returns the result of appui\options::full_options filtered with only the ones authorized to the current user.

get_all.name: get_all
get_all.summary: Returns the full list of permissions existing in the given option

get_full.name: get_full
get_full.summary: Returns the full list of permissions existing in the given option with all the current user's preferences

get.name: get
get.summary: Returns an option combined with its sole/first permission

has.name: has
has.summary: Checks if a user and/or a group has a permission.

has_deep.name: has_deep
has_deep.summary: Checks if a user and/or a group has a permission for the given option or for its childern.

is.name: is
is.summary: Checks if an option corresponds to the given path.

customize.name: customize
customize.summary: Adapts a given array of options' to user's permissions

add.name: add
add.summary: Grants a new permission to a user or a group

remove.name: remove
remove.summary: Deletes a preference for a path or an ID.

read_option.name: read_option
read_option.summary: Checks if the category represented by the given option ID is readable by the current user

write_option.name: write_option
write_option.summary: Checks if the category represented by the given option ID is writable by the current user

update_all.name: update_all

test.name: test
test.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: test
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

check.name: check
check.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: check
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

__call.name: __call

parent.name: __call

get_instance.name: get_instance
get_instance.summary: Returns the instance of the singleton or null.

retriever_exists.name: retriever_exists
retriever_exists.summary: Returns true if an instance as been initiated.

get_options_object.name: get_options_object

get_option_id.name: get_option_id
get_option_id.summary: Returns The option's ID of a category, i.e. direct children of option's root

get_options_ids.name: get_options_ids

get_appui_option_id.name: get_appui_option_id
get_appui_option_id.summary: Returns The option's ID of a category, i.e. direct children of option's root

get_appui_options_ids.name: get_appui_options_ids
